Class Request

java.lang.Object
application.Request
public class Request extends Object
Represents a Request made by a User, containing the request message, status, approval flags, and optional notes. Requests can be marked by an instructor or admin, closed or reopened, and may include references to prior versions.

This class supports the following features:

  • Tracking request content and the user who submitted it
  • Status management: OPEN, CLOSED, REOPENED
  • Notes appended in a semicolon-delimited format
  • Flags to track instructor and admin approval
  • An original request ID to support reopened requests

Use this class when retrieving, displaying, or modifying user-submitted requests in instructor/admin interfaces.

Author:
CSE 360 Team 8

  • Constructor Details

    • Request

      public Request(String request, User user)
      Constructs a new Request with default flags and status. This constructor is used when creating a request that is not yet stored in the database.
      Parameters:
      request - the request message
      user - the user who submitted the request

    • Request

      public Request(int id, String request, User user, boolean requestTOF, boolean requestATOF, String notes, String status, int originalId)
      Constructs a Request using all fields (used for DB retrieval).
      Parameters:
      id - the request ID
      request - the request message
      user - the submitting user
      requestTOF - the instructor approval flag
      requestATOF - the admin approval flag
      notes - semicolon-delimited notes
      status - the current status (e.g., "OPEN", "CLOSED")
      originalId - the original request ID if the request was reopened

    • Request

      public Request(String request, User user, boolean requestTOF, boolean requestATOF)
      Constructs a Request with approval flags pre-set.
      Parameters:
      request - the request message
      user - the user who submitted the request
      requestTOF - the instructor approval flag
      requestATOF - the admin approval flag

      public String getUserName()
      Returns the username associated with the request.

    • getRequestTOF

      public boolean getRequestTOF()
      Returns whether the instructor has acted on this request.
      Returns:
      true if the instructor approval flag is set, false otherwise

    • setRequestTOF

      public void setRequestTOF(boolean requestTOF)
      Sets the instructor approval flag.
      Parameters:
      requestTOF - true if the instructor has acted on the request

    • getRequestATOF

      public boolean getRequestATOF()
      Returns whether the admin has acted on this request.
      Returns:
      true if the admin approval flag is set, false otherwise

      Parameters:
      requestATOF - true if the admin has acted on the request
